message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question asks for a reason to choose zolpidem over a benzodiazepine. Among the options, only (C) is a valid reason, since benzodiazepines have a higher risk of tolerance and dependence. Zolpidem, on the other hand, has a lower risk of these adverse effects. Option (A) is incorrect, as zolpidem does bind to the GABA receptor. Option (B) is also incorrect, as zolpidem has a rapid onset of action. Option (D) is incorrect, as zolpidem is not typically used as a muscle relaxant.

Zolpidem does bind to the GABA receptor and has a faster onset of action than benzodiazepines, but the lower risk of tolerance and dependence makes it a better choice in this case. Zolpidem is not a potent muscle relaxant.
